title: Senioragency
content:
I thought the i and g would be a giveaway to find this font,...  
As I searched nearly everywhere and still couldn’t find it, I turn to the professionals ;-)

So, if anyone recognizes this font,  
I’m eager to know it’s name!

Thanks, A.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [adhesivo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051309/http:/typophile.com/files/adhesivo.jpg) | 72.11 KB |

 [‹ please identify urgent](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051309/http:/typophile.com/node/50549 "Go to previous forum topic") [LASER EXPERTS logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051309/http:/typophile.com/node/50568 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Allison Dh

comments.content: As a clue, it is not far from an [Linotype projekt](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051309/http:/www.linotype.com/fr/13947/linotypeprojektregular-police.html) or a [FS Ingrid](http://web.archive.org/web/20081020051309/http:/www.fontsmith.com/font_details.php?font_num=171)
Thanks Boris, but I do hope someone recognizes the actual typeface... A.
